page.title: 01GAZETTEER GREAT CANFIELD
page.content: The area surveyed is still totally rural; little changed in last 3C. There are{9 farms;}all but one owner- occupied; {55 houses} - occupants evenly divided between farmworkers, locally employed, commuters, retired.{ {Gt. Canfield}has a quiet but socially active community.{Amenities}have de- creased - pub, shop and school closed l920s; postoffice (front parlour of private cottage) closed l970s. Main social amenities: village hall, cricket clubhouse.{No public trans- {port.}(High Roding, sq. 12, has once weekly bus to Dunmow.) Proximity to motorways M11 & M25 (newly opened) plus planned expansion Stansted Air- port will bring considerable change in next decade to this Green Belt area. {Name Great Canfield}thought to be de- rived from Canes (reeds) found in un- drained marshland.
